==Events==
* [[475]] &ndash; [[List of Byzantine emperors|Byzantine Emperor]] [[Zeno (emperor)|Zeno]] is forced to flee his capital at [[Constantinople]], and his general, [[Basiliscus]] gains control of the empire.
* [[681]] &ndash; [[Twelfth Council of Toledo]]: King [[Erwig]] of the [[Visigoths]] initiates a council in which he implements diverse measures against the [[Jews]] in [[Spain]].
*[[1127]] &ndash; [[Jin campaigns against the Song Dynasty|Jin–Song wars]]: Invading [[Jurchen people|Jurchen]] soldiers from the [[Jin Dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin Dynasty]] [[Jingkang Incident|besiege and sack]] [[Kaifeng|Bianjing]] (Kaifeng), the capital of the [[Song Dynasty]] of [[China]], and abduct [[Emperor Qinzong of Song|Emperor Qinzong]] and others, ending the [[Northern Song Dynasty]].
*[[1150]] &ndash; [[Emperor Hailingwang of Jin|Prince Hailing of Jin]] and other court officials murder [[Emperor Xizong of Jin]]. Hailing succeeds him as emperor.
*[[1349]] &ndash; The Jewish population of [[Basel|Basel, Switzerland]], believed by the residents to be the cause of the ongoing [[Black Death]], is [[Basel massacre|rounded up and incinerated]].
*[[1431]] &ndash; Judges' investigations for the trial of [[Joan of Arc]] begin in [[Rouen|Rouen, France]], the seat of the English occupation government.
*[[1760]] &ndash; [[Afghanistan|Afghans]] defeat [[Maratha]]s in the Battle of Barari Ghat.
*[[1788]] &ndash; [[Connecticut]] becomes the fifth state to be admitted to the [[United States]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Jean-Pierre Blanchard]] becomes the first person to fly in a [[balloon]] in the United States.
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[William Pitt the Younger]] introduces an [[income tax]] of two [[shilling]]s to the [[Pound Sterling|pound]] to raise funds for Great Britain's war effort in the [[Napoleonic Wars]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson]] receives a [[state funeral]] and is interred in [[St Paul's Cathedral]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; Sir [[Humphry Davy]] tests [[Davy lamp|his safety lamp]] for miners at [[Hebburn]] Colliery.
*[[1822]] &ndash; The Portuguese prince [[Pedro I of Brazil]] decides to stay in [[Brazil]] against the orders of the Portuguese King [[João VI of Portugal|João VI]], beginning the Brazilian independence process.
*[[1839]] &ndash; The [[French Academy of Sciences]] announces the [[Daguerreotype]] [[photography]] process.
*[[1857]] &ndash; The [[1857 Fort Tejon earthquake|Fort Tejon earthquake]] strikes [[California]], registering an estimated magnitude of 7.9.
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Anson Jones]], the last President of the [[Republic of Texas]], commits suicide.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The "[[Star of the West]]" incident occurs near [[Charleston, South Carolina]]. It is considered by some historians to be the "First Shots of the American Civil War".
*  1861   &ndash; [[Mississippi]] becomes the second state to secede from the Union before the outbreak of the American Civil War.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: the [[Battle of Fort Hindman]] begins in [[Arkansas]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[Umberto I of Italy|Umberto I]] becomes [[House of Savoy|King of Italy]].
*[[1880]] &ndash; The [[Great Gale of 1880]] devastates parts of [[Oregon]] and [[Washington (state)|Washington]] with high winds and heavy snow.
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[New England Telephone and Telegraph Company|New England Telephone and Telegraph]] installs the first [[battery (electricity)|battery]]-operated [[telephone switchboard]] in [[Lexington, Massachusetts]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Hallam Tennyson, 2nd Baron Tennyson]], son of the poet [[Alfred, Lord Tennyson|Alfred Tennyson]], becomes the second [[Governor-General of Australia]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Ernest Shackleton]], leading the [[Nimrod Expedition]] to the [[South Pole]], plants the [[Flag of the United Kingdom|British flag]] {{convert|97|nmi|km mi}} from the South Pole, the [[Farthest South|farthest anyone had ever reached]] at that time.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Phi Beta Sigma]] Fraternity Inc., the first historically black intercollegiate Greek-letter fraternity to be officially recognized at Howard University, is founded.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Gallipoli Campaign|Battle of Gallipoli]] concludes with an [[Ottoman Empire]] victory when the last Allied forces are evacuated from the peninsula.
*[[1917]] &ndash; World War I: the [[Battle of Rafa]] is fought near the [[Egypt]]ian border with [[Palestine]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Battle of Bear Valley]]: The last battle of the [[American Indian Wars]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Greco-Turkish War (1919–1922)|Greco-Turkish War]]: The [[First Battle of İnönü]], the first battle of the war, begins near [[Eskişehir]] in [[Anatolia]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Juan de la Cierva]] makes the first [[autogyro]] flight.
*  1923   &ndash; [[Lithuanian people|Lithuanian]] residents of the [[Klaipėda Region|Memel Territory]] [[Klaipėda Revolt|rebel]] against the [[League of Nations]]' decision to leave the area as a [[League of Nations mandate|mandated region]] under [[France|French]] control.
*[[1927]] &ndash; A fire at the [[Laurier Palace Theatre fire|Laurier Palace movie theatre]] in [[Montreal|Montreal, Quebec, Canada]], kills 78 children.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Paul of Greece]] marries [[Frederica of Hanover]] in [[Athens]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: First flight of the [[Avro Lancaster]].
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: The Greek ''Triton'' (Y-5) sinks the Italian submarine ''Neghelli'' in [[Otranto]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The United States invades [[Luzon]] in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; Elizabeth "Betty" Short, the [[Black Dahlia]], is last seen alive.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Prime Minster of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] Sir [[Anthony Eden]] resigns from office following his failure to [[Suez Crisis|retake]] the [[Suez Canal]] from Egyptian sovereignty. 
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[President of Egypt]] [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] opens construction on the [[Aswan Dam]] by detonating ten tons of [[dynamite]] to demolish twenty tons of granite on the east bank of the [[Nile]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Martyrs' Day (Panama)|Martyrs' Day]]: Several [[Panama]]nian youths try to raise the Panamanian flag on the U.S.-controlled [[Panama Canal Zone]], leading to fighting between U.S. military and Panamanian civilians.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[Mirzapur Cadet College]] formally opens for academic activities in East Pakistan (now [[Bangladesh]]).
*[[1991]] &ndash; Representatives from the [[United States]] and [[Iraq]] meet at the [[Geneva Peace Conference]] to try to find a peaceful resolution to the Iraqi [[invasion of Kuwait]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[National Assembly of the Republika Srpska|Assembly of the Serb People in Bosnia and Herzegovina]] proclaims the creation of [[Republika Srpska]], a new state within [[Yugoslavia]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[First Chechen War]]: [[Chechen people|Chechen]] [[Separatism|separatists]] launch a raid against the helicopter airfield and later a civilian hospital in the city of [[Kizlyar]] in the neighboring [[Dagestan]], which turns into [[Kizlyar-Pervomayskoye hostage crisis|a massive hostage crisis]] involving thousands of [[civilian]]s.
*[[2004]] &ndash; An [[inflatable boat]] carrying illegal [[Albania]]n emigrants [[Karaburun tragedy|stalls]] near the [[Karaburun Peninsula, Albania|Karaburun Peninsula]] while on the way to [[Brindisi|Brindisi, Italy]]; exposure to the elements kills 28.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Mahmoud Abbas]] wins the [[Palestinian presidential election, 2005|election]] to replace [[Yasser Arafat]] as President of the [[Palestinian National Authority]]. He replaces interim president [[Rawhi Fattouh]].
*  2005   &ndash; The [[Sudan People's Liberation Movement]] and the [[Government of Sudan]] sign the [[Comprehensive Peace Agreement]] to end the [[Second Sudanese Civil War]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Apple CEO [[Steve Jobs]] unveils the first [[IPhone (original)|iPhone]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Iran Air Flight 277]] crashes near [[Orumiyeh]] in the northeast of the country, killing 77 people.
*[[2013]] &ndash; A [[SeaStreak]] ferry traveling to [[lower Manhattan]], [[New York City]], crashes into the dock, injuring 85 people.
*[[2014]] &ndash; An [[Mitsubishi Materials chemical plant explosion|explosion]] at a [[Mitsubishi Materials]] chemical plant in [[Yokkaichi, Mie|Yokkaichi]], [[Japan]], kills at least five people and injures 17 others.
